alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 5:13AM EST until December 19 at 2:54PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near East Juliette affecting Jones County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to develop. * WHERE...Falling Creek near East Juliette. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, bankfull conditions occur along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. At 13 feet, minor flooding begins in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge, upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning reaching a crest around 13.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
